page.title: 05OAKLANDS OLD PEOPLES HOME
page.content: The Oaklands is an old peoples home in Kirkburton. The actual building was built 115 years ago. It was a private house owned by L.B Holliday but when he died his son could not afford to run it .L.B Holliday put in his will that it should be an old peoples home. Since it became an old peoples home it has had two extensions built. The army built an extension for the ammunition. There are 32 rooms in the Oaklands. There are 3 kitchens,1 cold room,1 office,1 large sitting room,8 bedrooms for the residents and 7 bedrooms for the staff. Down in the cellar there is a boiler room, a wine room, a laundry room, workshop and a family room. To live at Oaklands people have to be over 65. There are 19 residents living there. There are 3 night staff,7 assitants,a cleaner,2 matrons and a handy man.
